title: General
stimulusHtml:
Up to 4 points

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation

Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature; Consistent with definition of biological species

Ability to cross-pollinate; Consistent with definition of biological species

Production of fertile offspring; Consistent with definition of biological species

Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules; Sufficient similarity supports single species

Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure; Similarity supports single species

Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants; Consistent with definition of biological species
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Up to 4 points

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation

Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature; Consistent with definition of biological species

Ability to cross-pollinate; Consistent with definition of biological species

Production of fertile offspring; Consistent with definition of biological species

Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules; Sufficient similarity supports single species

Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure; Similarity supports single species

Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants; Consistent with definition of biological species

The student response earns one of the following points:

Up to 4 points

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation

Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature; Consistent with definition of biological species

Ability to cross-pollinate; Consistent with definition of biological species

Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules; Sufficient similarity supports single species

Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure; Similarity supports single species

Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants; Consistent with definition of biological species

The student response earns two of the following points:

Up to 4 points

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation

Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules; Sufficient similarity supports single species

Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure; Similarity supports single species

Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants; Consistent with definition of biological species

The student response earns three of the following points:

Up to 4 points

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation

Ability to produce viable seeds/offspring in nature; Consistent with definition of biological species

Ability to cross-pollinate; Consistent with definition of biological species

Comparison of sequence of DNA or structures of other conserved molecules; Sufficient similarity supports single species

Comparison of chromosome number and/ or structure; Similarity supports single species

Fertile hybrid populations found living between the two other populations of plants; Consistent with definition of biological species

The student response earns four of the following points:

Two points for each of the following:

One point for Description of kind of data and One point for Explanation
